63.84.text:
- In 1970, about 44 years ago,
when I was a young man,

69.90.text:
I was killed
in a motorcycle wreck

72.56.text:
in Eugene, Oregon, and
I happened to have this wreck

76.40.text:
in front of
an ambulance location,

80.12.text:
and they just came around
and picked me up

81.48.text: and took me to the hospital.

83.00.text:
They put me in the ICU,
the intensive care unit,

85.56.text:
and about three hours later,
I went into a coma.

90.44.text:
there's scars here
on my wrist and stuff,

93.12.text:
leg injuries.
I have steel in my femur here.

96.68.text:
I have lost the kneecap
on my right leg.

101.08.text:
I had--
part of my wrist was

103.84.text:
up here by my elbow,
pushed up under the skin.

110.40.text:
So three hours later,
I went into a coma,

115.68.text:
- When I was
about five years old,

117.76.text:
I was recommended to go in
for a tonsillectomy

120.68.text:
because my, you know, my tonsils
were supposedly infected,

123.56.text:
and it turned out
that they actually weren't,

125.20.text:
so the doctor
didn't take them out,

126.76.text:
but I did go
through the operation.

129.92.text:
What happened was they took me
into the operating room,

132.60.text:
and in those days,
they had a big mask

135.12.text:
that they put over you

136.68.text:
It was a little different
than nowadays.

138.68.text:
And when they put the mask
over my face,

141.76.text:
he said, you know,
he just said, "Breathe deeply,"

144.04.text:
so I breathed, and it was okay,
pretty much,

146.44.text:
except that I, of course,
that I went out right away,

148.56.text:
which I would, being five,
you know?

152.56.text:
The next thing I knew,
I just shot up out of my body

157.52.text:
I looked down
and saw myself, you know,

163.08.text:
You know, I was just looking
at myself and them, and--

169.40.text:
- I became aware
of my clairvoyance

172.00.text:
at the age of 14
through a near-death experience.

175.36.text: Off and on for six years,

178.00.text: I just came to a point

180.56.text:
where I began to hear,
feel, and see.

185.44.text:
I had a second
near-death experience

191.72.text:
and in that experience,
all I can remember

195.44.text:
is rising above my body
into a vibrant green light,

200.36.text:
and when the two cars hit,
I never felt anything.

208.04.text:
It was as if I was
hovering above my body.

211.48.text: I could see myself very clearly.

217.80.text:
My consciousness was
floating above my body.

221.04.text:
The thinking part
of me was up here.

223.32.text:
This down here
just felt like a shell,

237.56.text:
immediately left my body
in the car

241.08.text:
and went through the tunnel
we hear people talk about,

244.60.text:
quickly, all the way through
to the other end

247.96.text:
and out the other end
into pure white light.

251.88.text:
I also was spoken to
with a voice,

254.72.text:
what some people call
a conversation with God.

260.16.text:
I was told immediately
when I entered the pure light

266.84.text:
and we all hear whatever voice
we need to hear

269.28.text:
in whatever language
in which we need to hear it--

271.52.text:
telling me,
"Lewis, you were called here

274.80.text:
"to have this conversation
and to be sent back,

277.80.text:
because you are not
doing your work."

282.88.text:
- The being of light is
definitely a being,

286.76.text:
but not with a face,
a figure, or anything else.

290.60.text: It's more of an energy center.

293.28.text:
It's a white light
that's described

295.36.text:
as having gold around the edges,
if you wish.

299.76.text:
most loving light
I've ever seen.

301.96.text: I've never been so in love

304.64.text:
or at home
or with my family or with--

310.08.text:
And I felt that this being
and I had known each other for--

315.40.text:
I use the term
"thousands of years" or "eons."

318.16.text:
We had--
we'd always known each other.

321.12.text:
no end, to how long
we've known each other.

323.48.text:
If you think
of each of our consciousnesses

326.08.text: as one little grain of sand

327.88.text:
and infinite intelligence
as the whole beach of sand,

332.88.text:
My little grain of sand was
back on the beach

334.80.text:
where I belonged,
where I came from.

339.60.text:
- And then, I saw somebody
come up to me in a black dress,

346.80.text:
whom I'd actually known
until I was about--

349.00.text:
well, she died
when I was, I think, 2 1/2

352.76.text:
I called her Ga-ga.
Everybody called her that,

354.72.text:
and I said, "Oh, Ga-ga,
I haven't seen you

356.60.text:
in such a long time,"
and I put out my hand.

358.72.text:
She took my hand,
and she said,

361.80.text:
"Well, you're just here
for a little visit."

365.88.text:
I remember being in,
like, a corridor

368.96.text:
of, like, a building
that we had gone into,

371.32.text:
and there was a long corridor
with doors off of it

374.56.text:
like a school.
It had cla--

376.20.text:
you know, like, classrooms,
different rooms.

378.72.text:
Well, they opened the door
to the classroom,

380.40.text:
and they said,
"You can look at this,

382.56.text:
you know, this is a classroom.
People are learning things."

385.44.text:
And they were at a keyboard.
They were actually--

388.60.text:
and you have to realize,
this is, like, 1951,

394.44.text:
There were no such things
as computers,

397.68.text:
They were big, huge,
room-sized things in those days,

400.76.text:
and nobody had ever heard
of such a thing, you know?

403.92.text:
There were--like, there were
typewriters, of course,

406.12.text:
but these were not keyboards
like that.

407.84.text:
They had little squares,
and they also lit up.

411.12.text:
I could see the light
underneath them.

413.48.text:
Like, some were blue,
and some were red,

417.16.text:
And I remember that the man
told me, he said,

420.16.text:
"You will see these later

425.52.text:
- But you know, I did have
an encounter in that encounter

428.44.text:
with a fellow who came to me
and introduced himself as Ben.

433.52.text:
He said that he had come
to be with me in this moment

437.60.text:
so that I would not have

440.64.text: and told me that the only thing

443.28.text:
that I needed to know moving

446.04.text:
is that I did not have
anything to worry about.

448.76.text:
'Cause I was hurt.
I was--I was hurt,

451.12.text:
and I was trapped in the car
for 45 minutes.

454.04.text:
But he had the most beautiful
eyes I've ever seen

459.32.text:
He called me by name
from the first meeting.

462.60.text:
He spoke very softly
and very gently.

464.56.text:
As soon as he touched me,
I completely went limp.

468.40.text:
But then, as he stepped
back from the car,

470.96.text: he said, "I have to go now,"

472.68.text:
and smiled
and vanished in thin air.

475.56.text:
And I knew I had literally been
touched by an angel.

482.80.text:
- I was in this state
of consciousness

487.36.text:
which was with my soul
and my spirit at this source.

493.36.text:
I was no longer in my body
at all.

496.40.text:
I said, "Well, I surrender.
Take me, I'm yours.

505.24.text:
"No, it's not my work
you need to do, Lewis.

509.24.text:
I then asked,
"Well, what is my work?"

514.20.text:
Since I was in a place
where all knowledge is known,

518.96.text:
I assumed I was gonna be told
what my work is.

523.48.text:
And instead of being told,
I was asked,

526.04.text:
"Well, what is it
that keeps you

529.16.text:
from being all you are
capable of being?"

533.32.text:
Well, I didn't know, because

536.92.text:
So I felt something
about difference

541.00.text:
that prevented my soul
from connecting

545.68.text:
I did not know
how to bridge the gap,

547.92.text:
and when I said this
in the light,

553.52.text:
just like the best moment
in the movie "Amadeus,"

556.28.text:
when Mozart hit a perfect note

560.08.text:
the voice of God said to me,
"There it is, Lewis.

I was then sent back
down the entire same tunnel

570.36.text:
and white light until
I remember coming into the body,

574.08.text:
until, like,
those tight rubber gloves.

576.96.text:
I'm not fully in until I am,
and then--

582.76.text:
and I was sitting
in my automobile--

And I walked out of the car
into the ambulance to tell them,

596.84.text:
- I was a young man
in my early 20s,

599.16.text: and I decided to come back here.

601.52.text:
I wasn't done with the reason
I had been here.

608.32.text:
getting smaller,
and coming into my body.

It was like slamming back

616.36.text:
So I come back--
at that time, a college student

622.36.text:
I come back into this life,
and I go on with that career,

626.88.text:
but they're teaching me
Newtonian physics.

628.76.text:
They're teaching me
that this is--3D is it,

631.16.text:
and I'm always,
from the beginning,

633.52.text:
from then on,
I'm on the other side.

635.40.text:
"No, no, there's
all the rest of this energy.

638.04.text:
There's all the rest
of this out here."

643.84.text:
- I don't remember going in
specifically to my body,

647.20.text:
except that, you know,
it was much--

649.52.text:
it was like going down
a very small--

654.56.text:
You know, it was, like,
I just swooshed back in.

657.44.text:
And I heard the doctor say,
"I thought we were

659.20.text:
going to lose her
there for a minute."

661.08.text: I tried to lift my arm,

663.36.text:
and it felt so heavy

667.16.text:
and it was so nice being
not in a body,

672.12.text:
and I could just go
where I wanted to,

675.68.text:
And I tried to lift my arm

678.64.text:
and I thought to myself,

685.12.text:
- And then,
without any warning whatsoever,

690.32.text:
it's just like someone thrust me
back into my body again.

693.60.text:
I came to consciousness
about 90 seconds later

699.44.text:
I was actually impaled
on the dash with my knee

710.60.text:
then I started feeling pain
in my right foot, my knee.

715.56.text:
My arm was broken,
my ribs were broken.

721.08.text:
who was bound and determined

724.52.text: and was yanking on the door

726.48.text:
and screaming
for people to help,

728.40.text:
for her to get me

730.82.text:
But had she got out me
out of the car,

739.88.text:
- First off, when I had
the near-death experience

742.24.text:
in 1970,
I started talking about it.

745.08.text:
And this--I was
on the head injury floor,

747.24.text:
and so the chief psychiatrist
wanted to put me in the nuthouse

752.60.text:
You died and you came back?
What is that?"

756.24.text:
So he wants to throw me
in the nuthouse,

759.88.text:
They've heard,
they've seen it too many times,

761.80.text:
and they're hugging me
and saying, "Shh. Don't."

764.52.text:
"Yeah, but it's true.
I got to tell him."

767.80.text:
"So you think you're Jesus?"
And I say, "Look.

769.76.text:
"I went there, I did it.
You got a degree.

772.32.text:
"You're a doctor and all that,
but you've never been there,

775.08.text:
"and you're telling me
it doesn't exist

778.48.text:
I believe they may have given
my body painkillers,

780.92.text: but I was out of the body.

782.80.text:
So people say, "Well, it's
a drug effect in your mind."

784.68.text: No, I'm out of the body.

786.60.text:
I remember coming back
into the room

788.24.text: and coming back into the body

789.60.text:
and seeing myself
and coming into it.

791.48.text:
I finally get
out of the hospital.

793.60.text: I go to the pastor at my church,

795.72.text:
and he says, "Well,
it can't possibly be true,

799.40.text:
because it doesn't agree
with scripture."

802.84.text:
"It doesn't agree with your
interpretation of the scripture.

810.04.text:
Those people who want to say,
"Well, it was a drug,"

815.88.text:
they're looking for it
to be something else

817.92.text:
because they don't want
to hear what we're saying.

820.28.text:
- I would say not to let
other people discourage you.

823.08.text:
Some people let other people
say, "Oh, well,

825.16.text:
you couldn't have seen that,"
or you couldn't have,

826.72.text:
you know, "da da da,"
and of course,

828.64.text:
I would say
believe in what you have seen

831.40.text:
and what you've experienced,
you know?

833.08.text:
If you did experience this,
it's a good thing.

837.72.text:
- There was no confusion.
This was not a dream.

841.44.text:
This was my real experience
of my soul outside of my body,

846.84.text:
outside of my personality,
outside of my ego,

850.20.text: and outside of my human form,

852.24.text:
having a real experience
at what I call "the source

857.64.text:
of all energy and all spirit
from which we all come."

863.52.text:
Just, when I say
"I've been in the light

868.92.text:
"where there's nothing
but love and light and truth

871.96.text:
and peace and grace,"
they are still not enough,

876.32.text:
when you add
all the words together,

878.12.text:
to fully describe
what I experienced.

880.92.text:
- It was more real
than this reality.

885.96.text:
better than anything else
in our life.

889.76.text:
It is burned into our mind
because it was more real.

894.96.text:
So, for people,
how to believe it?

899.04.text:
They always want me to give them
that one, how to believe it.

902.08.text: Walk a mile in my shoes?

903.88.text:
Go have your own
near-death experience?

905.60.text:
Here, let me get a gun.
We'll shoot you, see if you die.

907.68.text:
You know, I mean,
we can't do that.

909.56.text:
So they want--
they want to know like I do.

913.76.text: I was lucky to be killed.

917.80.text:
I was lucky to be killed
and then to come back

921.30.text:
so that I could say all of this
and know all of this.

927.20.text:
- Well, my sense
about near-death experience

929.36.text:
is the same
as when I hear a story

931.12.text:
about psychic experience
or mystical experience

934.00.text:
or in fact
any strange experience.

936.48.text:
On the one hand, it is
somebody's actual experience,

940.24.text:
so you need to listen to it
carefully

942.72.text:
and compare it against
other people's experiences.

946.40.text:
Then the question is,
if it's very strange,

948.88.text: if it doesn't happen very often,

950.56.text:
you have to figure out
how to interpret what it means.

954.16.text:
Some people will interpret
a near-death experience

956.56.text:
as meaning that they have
literally separated

959.04.text: from their body in some way

960.56.text:
and the identification
of who they are

966.08.text:
it's something else, a spirit,
a soul, something like that.

969.36.text:
It's been very difficult
to do scientific research

972.08.text:
on these kinds of experiences
because it's not ethical

975.92.text:
to try to induce
a near-death experience,

979.20.text:
and they tend
to happen spontaneously,

981.36.text:
so it's very difficult to know
when it's gonna happen.

984.48.text:
On the other hand,
there are instances

987.68.text:
in which people claim
to separate from their body,

990.00.text:
and they can correctly
describe things

994.80.text:
That's when I become
more interested,

996.80.text:
because those are things
that can be tested,

999.52.text:
and you don't need
to have somebody

1001.52.text:
in a near-death condition
in order to test it.

1004.96.text:
So what we have focused on,
what my research focuses on

1008.48.text:
mostly is people
who are not near death

1014.48.text:
who are asked, for example,
to describe something

1017.36.text: at a distance or that is hidden.

1019.76.text:
And we have pretty good evidence
that people can do that.

1023.44.text:
- For me to share with you
that I have perfect memory

1027.28.text:
of every experience
I had in the tunnel

1030.32.text:
and in the light
and in my conversation with God

1034.80.text:
as clearly
as I'm talking to you now,

1038.40.text:
is not able to be proven
scientifically

1043.04.text:
because our understanding
of the word "memory"

1046.56.text: is that it is in the brain,

1049.60.text:
and the brain was in the body,
and the body was in the car,

1055.12.text:
so no, I cannot prove
to you scientifically

1058.80.text:
how I can have perfect memory
of this experience.

1065.60.text:
the belief is that the brain
creates the consciousness.

1069.04.text:
This is a thing
we're taught in grade school,

1071.20.text:
that the brain
makes the consciousness.

1073.28.text:
The truth is,
and they're coming--

1076.00.text:
physics is coming up
against this one big-time now.

1078.56.text:
The truth is
that the consciousness

1080.16.text:
makes the brain
and not the other way around.

1084.72.text:
The brain is just
like a television set,

1088.20.text:
The consciousness exists
outside the body.

1090.84.text:
If you think
about your consciousness

1093.48.text: as existing outside of your body

1095.72.text:
but telling itself that
the locus of your consciousness

1099.28.text:
is in your head,
so then you're gonna

1103.36.text:
then you can see how easy
it is to go out-of-body.

You just shift
where you're thinking it is.

1107.84.text:
You say, "Okay,
I'm no longer in this computer,

1109.84.text:
"I'm out here in this one.
Click."

1113.20.text:
Okay, now I can look
down at my body.

1115.12.text:
Okay, if I want to make my locus
back inside the head,

1119.36.text:
- Can we demonstrate
that consciousness is non-local?

1122.96.text:
And by that, meaning
that you can gain information

1125.52.text:
from a distance
in space or time.

1127.52.text:
The answer is yes, because
we can do good experiments

1130.24.text:
to test
whether that is possible,

1132.56.text:
and I believe that
if you dispassionately

1135.12.text:
look at the evidence
that is available,

1137.20.text:
then you will find
that the answer is yes.

1139.44.text:
Or at least
that we have high confidence

1142.80.text:
that people can gain information
from a distance

1148.48.text:
the thing that we call
"the brain"

1150.40.text:
in order to be aware,
and maybe not.

1153.36.text:
Maybe any sufficiently complex
system would do,

1158.56.text:
- And since science does not yet
know how to explain all this,

1162.64.text:
there is--
there are many experiences

1165.44.text:
which are very similar
to how we felt

1168.32.text:
when you and I tried to decide

Or when we tried to decide

1180.64.text:
because science could not

1183.04.text:
to our left frontal lobe's

That is where we now are
in this description

of our experiences

- Unless we know

or awareness,

1199.60.text:
So then it changes the question

1204.40.text:
of what I'm capable of

1207.92.text:
And the traditional answer

1209.76.text:
which I think is probably

You get to deeper and deeper

where we might say that somebody

all of those people,

- We all leave

but it's very similar,

The sleeping, I've heard that

1263.28.text:
you know, people feel like

or there's something

There was a young girl

1289.76.text:
of being in the body

although on the physical side,
us as humans,

we see a car crash

2577.92.text:
then we are better able
to hear and understand

2583.60.text:
and talk more ourselves
about it.

2585.52.text:
And that change
is happening very quickly.

2589.92.text:
- It's true that
because of rising interest

2594.08.text:
in consciousness studies that--
some of it is science,

2598.64.text:
but a large part of it is also
scholarship and philosophy.

2602.48.text:
So there are many different ways
of getting into this topic,

2607.52.text:
don't know
how to talk to each other,

2609.04.text:
and sometimes the scholars
and the historians

2611.12.text:
are talking about something
completely different,

2614.40.text:
You know,
it's a big and important topic,

2616.24.text:
and so you have conferences
with thousands of people

2619.44.text:
all coming at it
from slightly different angles,

2621.60.text:
which I take actually
as a good sign,

2623.52.text:
because it means it's not likely
to collapse prematurely

2626.72.text: into "This is the way to do it."

2631.12.text:
which makes it interesting
and also challenging

2633.44.text:
to figure out
what's the best way to study.

2635.84.text: And maybe there is no best way.

2637.36.text:
It's--everybody has
their own best way.

2653.44.text:
less defined by any one religion
or another.

2658.88.text:
So all religions,
in my opinion and experience,

2662.56.text:
have true spirituality
at the core,

2664.96.text:
and all religions,
to different degrees

2668.16.text:
and in different ways,
are guilty

2670.24.text:
of a form of righteousness
that has the details

2674.88.text:
of their description be
perceived of as the correct ones

2679.60.text: and the others the wrong ones.

2682.72.text:
So the more
we come together as one

2687.28.text:
and realize the common goals
we have

2689.44.text:
and listen
to each others' spirituality

2694.16.text:
actually, we will start to
learn that, at the core,

2697.12.text:
we are all feeling and believing
mostly the same things,

2700.88.text:
and that the details
that are different

2705.44.text:
that they deserve
killing one another over them.

2710.16.text:
- I would say we're experiencing
a spiritual evolution.

2713.12.text:
70% of Americans do believe
that there's an afterlife.

2718.64.text:
Okay, around 35, 40%
truly believe in mediums

2723.04.text:
being able to talk
to the other side.

2725.20.text:
- I have seen
a tremendous increase

2728.56.text:
in the last two years,
but I noticed the increase,

2733.36.text:
probably about five
to eight years ago, begin.

2738.08.text:
People are awakening
and seeing more,

2741.44.text:
and especially in children
who are being born today,

2745.20.text:
they're being born
much more perceptive,

2747.36.text:
much more psychic,
much more clairvoyant,

2749.84.text:
much more empathic
than they've ever been before.

2753.92.text:
My belief, my hope
is that it is to improve

2758.40.text:
the circumstances
on the Earth plane,

2761.36.text: to bring us back to love.

2765.04.text:
So that we can better
help one another.

2768.16.text:
- I don't think that
that experience

2769.92.text:
necessarily changes you,
per se, into a person

2773.52.text:
who's selfless and helpful
and all that, you know,

2777.04.text:
and good and whatever
like that.

2779.20.text:
I think people have been having
that experience for centuries,

2782.08.text:
but they may or may not
have gotten

2787.60.text:
and it's kind of nice
to think that the world

2790.40.text: would someday turn into a place

2792.00.text:
that people would want
to stay and want to live.

2795.44.text:
But the fact is that
I guess we're in the world

2797.84.text:
because we are supposed to be
presented with problems

2801.12.text:
to solve, and that's the way
we're trying to do it.

2805.04.text:
- A lot of people have
wounds in their heart,

2809.60.text:
and those wounds in their heart
make them feel

2813.28.text:
and so a lot of people feel
like it's, you know, it's--

2817.12.text:
it's a race to make
the most money,

2820.96.text:
to have
all these external things

2824.48.text: that none of us really need,

2826.32.text:
but there's a part of them,
and there's a part of us

2828.00.text:
that believes we need that
to be happy, to have joy.

2833.44.text:
"Well, why do people suffer
if we all have angels?

2836.24.text:
Why do people suffer?
Why do bad things happen?"

2839.52.text:
We all have free will
and we all have a choice.

2845.04.text:
We can choose to be angry
or we can choose to be at peace.

2849.20.text:
None of us are alone,
and if we really knew

2852.48.text:
who stood beside us and
behind us and in front of us,

2857.04.text:
We'd never be afraid
to go after our dreams

2860.16.text:
and live our best life
and take that chance

2865.12.text:
We wouldn't be afraid
that we didn't have money

2868.00.text:
to do the things
that we wanted to do.

2869.36.text:
We wouldn't be afraid
to do anything.

2873.12.text:
and we would walk
with blind faith,

2875.28.text:
just knowing that everything
was always gonna work out

2878.88.text:
- As my friend
and spiritual teacher

2880.80.text: who passed away would say to me,

2883.20.text:
"Every moment, every breath,
is a moment of creation."

2888.32.text:
Some people get so s--
caught in the process of,

2892.00.text:
"Oh, I want this, and I want
this, and I want this,"

2895.68.text:
and then it doesn't show up
immediately,

2898.24.text:
so then they're like,
"Well that's not gonna happen."

2905.44.text:
Now you've got five minutes
of moving toward it

2908.96.text:
and all of a sudden, "Oh, well,
it's not going to happen."

2916.00.text:
So--and I mean, I tell--
I tell my clients that as well

2920.00.text:
that come here, you know,
I can predict

2923.20.text: but I can't make it happen.

2926.24.text:
So when you come to me
for a reading,

2928.32.text:
I give you a snapshot
of what I see as possibility.

2932.80.text:
It's up to the client
to create it.

2936.96.text:
Have you ever had a day
that just started out

2940.00.text: to be the absolute worst day,

2942.08.text:
and you were
in the absolute worst mood,

2944.00.text:
and it just progressed
through the entire day?

2948.80.text:
That's because your energy's
progressing negativity.

2954.24.text:
If you can stop, take a breath,
refresh, and refocus...

2960.00.text:
I tell people,
"Turn on your GPS.

2964.64.text:
"When you get up in the morning,
when your feet hit the floor,

2967.52.text:
you state what you want
your day to be."

2975.84.text:
and what you see
and what you know,

2977.44.text:
and if you're doing
something good and trying to be,

2980.16.text:
you know, trying to be good
and beneficial to the world,

2983.24.text:
then the things people say
are not--

2986.40.text:
they're not real.
They don't matter.

2988.80.text:
So that's what I--that's what
I usually say, you know.

2992.40.text:
Just believe in what you have
as your own intuition.

2996.96.text:
- There are only two ways,
fear and love, nothing else.

3000.24.text:
The rest doesn't exist,
and fear is false.

3004.16.text:
We use it,
"False evidence appearing real."

3010.56.text:
False evidence
appearing to be real.

3013.52.text:
that's what fear is.
It's not real.
